title.narrative: Flood Management and River Basin Master Plan for the Welang River

description.narrative: This project is conducted under the bilateral water cooperation between Indonesia and the Netherlands. The overall aim is to support East Java Province (EJP) and its partners in integral river basin management of the Welang river and in the development of a River Basin Master Plan and an Implementation Programme for the measures (structural and non-structural) that will lead to flood safety and the improvement of other water resource related issues in the coming decades. This project intends to facilitate effective and inclusive government decision-making on flood safety investments, and to support a solid preparation for the application of available funding.The project has five pillars: A. Understand the Welang River basinEJP is supported in developing a thorough understanding of the (physical, ecological, social and economic) character of the Welang river and is equipped to make decisions and to improve flood safety in an integral, inclusive and sustainable manner.B. Welang Integrated River Basin Master PlanEJP has a plan for integral river basin management of the Welang river for the long term(+15 years). EJP has a clear vision on its priorities to improve the river basin in the coming 5 years. EJP is able to use the IRBM approach in other rivers.C. Solve and innovateEJP is supported in the development of a coherent package of conceptual designs for thedesired hard and soft measures. EJP is inspired by and able to apply innovative technologies and approaches, such as Building With Nature.D. Develop inclusive policyEJP is supported in and advised upon maximizing inclusiveness in integral river basinmanagement and in the development of hard and soft measures, so that is ensured thatno community or social group is left behind or prevented from benefiting fromimprovements. E. Strengthen capacities & institutionsThe individual and organizational capabilities of EJP are strengthened so that EJP isable to apply the elements of Integrated River Basin Management in practice. Knowledge isdeveloped in co-creation with parties from the ‘quadruple helix’ (government, industries,civil society and knowledge institutions) and focused on innovative solutions for societalchallenges.This project is conducted in cooperation with: Witteveen+Bos, Wetlands International, Deltares, PTWBI, ITS University, Rebel, HZ University of Applied Science, The Water Agency, Netics BV and East Java Province.
